While VPNs and proxies can seem very similar at first glance – they’re meant for ENTIRELY different things. So today, I’ll cover all the VPN vs proxy differences and show you exactly what each can be used for.

–––––––––––––––––––––––––––––
🔎 Main VPN and proxy similarity

At a very basic level, both a VPN and a proxy server will route your traffic through a remote server  – and assign you a new IP address. An IP address is what identifies your device and in turn – your real location – so changing it helps you gain a certain level of anonymity.
